website_summaries.verdict: A cotton welding jacket with snaps that resists flames and gives good coverage.
cons: The material is on the thin side and may not be as suitable for heavy-duty use as some thicker jackets

customer_reviews.title: Good welding jacket
customer_reviews.text: I needed a jacket to protect me during my welding sessions. I wanted a jacket because it provides more coverage (arms, torso, waist, etc) than just sleeves or a bib. The jacket is well made, heavy duty and seems to be made of high quality materials. The only down side is it is a little on the heavy side when you first put it on but after a while I didn't notice the weight. And it can be warm if used in warm climates (but this can be a good thing in colder climates). Overall I am very satisfied with the jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nakamura

customer_reviews.title: It is Also Warm for Winter Temps
customer_reviews.text: I am not a welder but I am a woodworker and this makes a great turning smock, it keeps wood chips and saw dust from going down my neck. I typically wear an acrylic hood which hangs below the high neck line of the smock which completely eliminates chips from even getting close to the neck line. It is on the warm side so I don't use it much in the summer but during the winter I keep my shop at about 60deg and it is perfect for that kind of temperature.
customer_reviews.author: JD Combs

customer_reviews.title: pockets stitching is terrible. don't expect more than 6 months of use

I mig weld and these work good untill they fall apart from washing just like any other chinese garbage we buy. Leather is too hot in the shop I work at , mainly use it for the UV ray protection on my arms. sleeves are hot and fall down. this works good with a t-shirt underneath. keeps the aluminum weld smoke stink off your arms for the most part.
